definition: to bend over one's desk (writing, studying, taking a nap etc)
surname Fu
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table

sentences.english: The window, his desk writing the lonely.
sentences.chinese: 窗前，他伏案書寫着寂寞。

sentences.english: Long hours at the desk can cause musculoskeletal problems and hand problems.
sentences.chinese: 長時間伏案於寫字檯會引起肌骨骼和手部疾病。
爲什麼盞燈伏案還要寫呢？

sentences.english: If you are going to be chained to your desk, you’ll want to be comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要長時間伏案工作，你會希望過得得舒服點。

sentences.english: She stared at her son studying at the desk with loving eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她脈脈地注視着伏案苦讀的兒子。

sentences.english: In the past so many nights, I sat at the table for this particular month writing.
sentences.chinese: 在曾經的多少個夜晚，我伏案爲這個特殊的月份寫作。

sentences.english: After working on the computer for a long time, do you have a backache?
sentences.chinese: 當您長時間面對電腦伏案工作，受否感到腰痠背痛？

sentences.english: He spends his lunch hour at his desk working frantically to finish the project ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 他會在午餐時間瘋狂伏案工作，以求提前完成項目。

sentences.english: The editor has been slaving at his desk for hours .
sentences.chinese: 編輯已伏案辛勞了好幾個小時了。

sentences.english: I don't think a sedentary life would altogether suit me.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲長期伏案的生活一點也不適合我。

sentences.english: I start out for a walk at last after weeks at the desk.
sentences.chinese: 伏案數週之後，我終於開始出去走走。

definition: to write at a tremendous speed
to scribble rapidly
to read through to evaluate/to referee
to take up one's pen/to start to write
official documents or correspondence
to light a lamp/to raise a lantern
to immerse oneself in (one's work, studies etc)
on one's desk
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to read (honorific: e.g. your distinguished article)
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
incessant/relentless
to write characters
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
in the dead of night (idiom)
